CEEvent.Name: TB_tired_men
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12500}Your troops are exhausted after the long march, and you hear grumbling in the ranks. You may need to find something to lift their spirits soon...

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12501}Your troops are not weak peasants - they'll manage.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12502}Offer your sympathies and order a brief rest.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12503}Crack open a cask of wine and stop for a brief feast.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12499}Give a rousing speech - take their minds off their feet.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12504}Thankfully you identified a cache of medicinal mushrooms - share them.

CEEvent.Name: TB_ill_omen
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12505}Your troops report that a cloud of ravens were seen heading east, and that they briefly blocked out the sun when doing so. They argue amongst themselves as to whether this is a good or bad omen.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12507}Try to convince them this is a good omen.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12508}Order your scouts to hunt the birds down.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12509}Give a performance with smoke and fire interpreting the omen as benevolent.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12510}Pose against the setting sun, your sword aloft, and proclaim the righteousness of your cause.

CEEvent.Name: TB_ill_tidings
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12511}News of a rival lord's tremendous victory in battle has reached you, and some of your troops have begun to lose their nerve, intimidated by stories of brutal killings and maimed corpses on the battlefield. Others are more sanguine, and chastise the fearful for their cowardice.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12512}[Lie] These are lies directed to sap your men's morale.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12513}Perhaps this lord was successful, but how much more successful will you be?
{=BCCaptor_Text_12514}Explain in detail the treachery this lord used to secure his victory.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12515}Give a rousing speech - others may win small battles, but right is on your side!

CEEvent.Name: TB_good_tidings
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12516}You receive word that one of your enemies has suffered a terrible defeat and been captured in battle. The good news puts a spring in your step, and you eagerly share the news with your troops. One less thing to worry about - for now.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12519}Regale your troops with the story of how your subterfuge led to this victory.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12520}Give a rousing speech - this is but one of many victories, for right is on your side!

CEEvent.Name: TB_sick_horse
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12521}One of your horses has grown sick, and is slowing down your group. It's served you well, but can no longer walk.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12523}Have the horse put on a cart and tended to.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12524}Put the creature out of its misery.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12525}The horse isn't sick, it's just sad; cheer it up.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12526}You know just the herbs to cure this issue.

CEEvent.Name: TB_poisoned_food
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12527}Several of your men report horrible stomachaches and vomiting. The affliction begins to spread through your camp, and you suspect something was wrong with yesterday's rations.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12529}Tell your troops to take the day to rest.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12531}They just drank too much. Take the opportunity to sell them a hangover cure.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12532}You know just the thing to cure this malady.

CEEvent.Name: TB_broken_cart
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12533}One of your army's carts has broken down; its wheel got stuck in a rut and the spokes shattered. Its contents won't be going anywhere soon...

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12535}Surely someone in your army can fix it. Find them.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12536}Order your men to move the supplies to a different cart.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12537}Order the men responsible to cover the cost of the lost supplies.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12538}You know precisely how to fix this!

CEEvent.Name: TB_wildfire
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12539}Smoke is heavy in the crimson air, and before long you see a wildfire in the distance. It's heading your way, and your troops seem more than a little apprehensive about the idea of being burned alive.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12541}Ride across a nearby stream and wait out the fire.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12542}Order your men to dig a ditch between the fire and your army.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12543}The wind is blowing in the opposite direction. This isn't a problem.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12544}Call your siege team to put out the fire.

CEEvent.Name: TB_informal_joust
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12545}During a brief rest, some of your troops have begun betting on an informal joust between two notoriously competitive soldiers. Lacking horses, they instead each mount the shoulders of one of their brawnier friends and begin rushing at each other, bringing makeshift wooden lances to bear.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12546}This sounds like a terrible idea. Stop them.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12547}It's their necks on the line. Bet on the victor.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12548}Take the opportunity to learn about your troops' fighting styles.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12549}Betting on a winner, eh? You know a few tricks to make some coin here.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12550}Take the opportunity to teach your men a valuable lesson about skirmishing.

CEEvent.Name: TB_thunderstorm
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12551}Dark clouds cover the horizon, and a moistness fills the air. Before long your army is caught in a massive downpour, sheets of freezing water soaking into your clothes. In the distance, you begin to hear peals of thunder and see flashes of searing lightning. The horses grow restless, and the mud gathering on the ground makes progress difficult.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12552}Why should you let a little wetness stop you? Continue your march.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12553}Stop under the trees for shelter. Hopefully lightning won't strike...
{=BCCaptor_Text_12554}Find some high ground between trees to wait this out.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12555}Order your men to set up camp near - but not too near - some trees.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12556}Time to put your siegecrafting team to work.

CEEvent.Name: TB_sandstorm
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12557}A bright cloud of sand is visible in the distance, and it seems to be getting closer with distressing speed. You'll have to do something quickly or risk getting flayed alive by the storm.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12558}Why should you let some paltry sand stop you? Continue your march.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12559}Stop on the near side of a dune for shelter.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12560}Reassure your troops; find some low ground between dunes to wait this out, and set up shelter.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12561}Seek shelter in a nearby spot of vegetation.
{=BCCaptor_Text_12562}Time to put your siegecrafting team to work.

CEEvent.Name: TB_rescue_prisoner_hero
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12563}You chance upon a huddled, filthy person on the road, and as you approach realize it's a bound woman. She looks exhausted and famished, and explains that she's only just escaped captivity at the hands of some bandits. She begs you to take her with you; she has nothing left here, and asks if you will help her get revenge against the ones who wronged her.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12564}Order her washed and bring her along.
{=TBRandomEvents_Solo009}Refuse; you've not enough food as it is.

CEEvent.Name: TB_rescue_prisoner
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12565}You chance upon a huddled, filthy person on the road, and as you approach realize it's a bound man. He looks exhausted and famished, his enormously muscled body covered in wounds, and explains that he's only just escaped captivity at the hands of some bandits. He begs you to let him join you that he might get revenge against his captors for what they did to him.

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12566}Order him washed and bring him along.
{=TBRandomEvents_Solo009}Refuse; you've not enough food as it is.

CEEvent.Name: TB_rescue_prisoner_swordsister
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12567}You chance upon a huddled figure on the road, and as you approach realize it's a bound woman. She looks exhausted and famished, and her body is covered with terrible wounds, but you sense a burning fire in her eyes. She explains that she's only just escaped captivity at the hands of some bandits. She begs you to let her join your banner to get vengeance upon them for what they did to her.

CEEvent.Name: TB_deserters
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12569}Your scouts report that they've found a group of ragged soldiers, deserters from a nearby army. They are in no condition to fight you, and beg for you to give them enough food to survive, a least for a few more days.

Option.OptionText: {=TBRandomEvents_Solo009}Refuse; you've not enough food as it is.

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_bush
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12665}A beautiful young village woman strides confidently to draw water at the small oasis where your party has stopped. She meets your gaze without fear, and her skin glistens in the brutal sun. You cannot take your eyes from her...

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_washer_flirt
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12678}"Greetings, gallant {?PLAYER.GENDER}Lady{?}Lord{\?}! Have you a load which needs scrubbing? Do you require soap?"

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12679}"It seems everything I require is here before me."

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_washer_bathe
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12680}"My {?PLAYER.GENDER}Lady{?}Lord{\?}! Your eyes are drawn over my body in a most improper manner! Please leave me, as I must scrub all this soap off me."

Option.OptionText: {=BCCaptor_Text_12681}Follow her down to the bathing pond.

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_washer_clean
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12682}You watch the woman bathe herself. She knows you are there, but does not seem to hide or hurry, content to rinse off the washing soap. Eventually, she is done, and makes her way out of the pond.

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_washer_nope
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12684}"My {?PLAYER.GENDER}Lady{?}Lord{\?}! I asked you to leave me, but you have taken pleasure in watching me at my most vulnerable. I do not know what you expect of me, but I must go now. Perhaps we will meet again, in a more approprate setting." With that dismissal, she swims to the far side of the pond and disappears in the reeds.

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_washer_jackpot
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12685}"My {?PLAYER.GENDER}Lady{?}Lord{\?}! I asked you to leave me, but you have taken pleasure in watching me at my most vulnerable. You must be in quite a state of arousal now."

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_washer_sex_act_f
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12671}You spend a few magical hours together, and she teaches you some of the local customs and practices. She seems wise beyond her years, but with the strength of youthful vigor in full bloom.

CEEvent.Name: BC_event_wanderer_washer_sex_act_m
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12671}You spend a few magical hours together, and she teaches you some of the local customs and practices. She seems wise beyond her years, but with the strength of youthful vigor in full bloom.

CEEvent.Name: CE_random_event_companions_female_f
CEEvent.Text: {=DefaultRandomEventsCompanionsFemale1}{COMPANION_NAME_1} asks to speak with you. You invite her to your tent. {COMPANION_NAME_1} says your troops have been lazy lately and need more exercise.

Option.OptionText: {=DefaultRandomEventsCompanionsFemale3}Kick away for a waste of time.

CEEvent.Name: CE_spouse_event_female_female_1
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12687}You hear the clop of hooves heading towards you, and as you look up your heart jumps - your spouse has come to visit, and {COMPANION_NAME_1} practically leaps into arms, kissing you deeply.

CEEvent.Name: CE_spouse_event_female_female_city_1
CEEvent.Text: {=DefaultSpouseEventsFemale8}Your spouse joins you in your room. He begins to playfully touch you, trying to arouse you. He asks you to join him in bed.

CEEvent.Name: CE_spouse_event_female_1
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12687}You hear the clop of hooves heading towards you, and as you look up your heart jumps - your spouse has come to visit, and {COMPANION_NAME_1} practically leaps into arms, kissing you deeply.

CEEvent.Name: CE_spouse_event_female_city_1
CEEvent.Text: {=BCCaptor_Text_12689}Your spouse has come to visit: {COMPANION_NAME_1} practically leaps into arms, kissing you deeply.
